snippet: Mr. Slim, who lent the newspaper money during the financial downturn, exercised warrants received as a part of that deal.
abstract: New York Times Company announces that Carlos Slim Helu has acquired almost 16 million more shares of its Class A stock at more than $6.36 a share by exercising warrants, more than doubling his stake in company.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Slim, who lent the newspaper money during the financial downturn, exercised warrants received as a part of that deal.

headline.main: Carlos Slim More Than Doubles His Stake in Times Company
headline.print_headline: Mexican Investor More Than Doubles His Stake in Times Company
